title: MJA failed to get support in New Juaben
text:
Politics | 22 October 2015 23:00 CET MJA failed to get support in New Juaben By GNA 
Koforidua (E/R), Oct 22, GNA - An attempt by the Movement for Joint Action (MJA) to mobilize the people of New Juaben Municipality to support their demonstration to back their demand for the change of the current voter's register at Koforidua failed to get the needed support. 
At the end, the number of police personnel deployed to protect the demonstrators were more than the demonstrators on the street. 
New Juaben Municipal Area is one of the strongholds of the New Patriotic Party (NPP), the leading opposition party in Ghana whose position on the current voter's register in the country is being champion by the MJA. 
At the last elections, the NPP won the two constituencies in the New Juaben, New Juaben North and New Juaben South constituencies. 
Addressing the demonstrators, Mr Pharm Silas Agyekum, Director of Operations of MJA said, about 2.4 percent of the current voter's register of the country was made up of foreigners and cannot be used to elect the President for the country in the 2016 general election. 
He said the best option now is to have a new register without foreigners and other irregularity which every Ghanaian will have confidence in. 
The three and half hours demonstration which drew about 100 people, started around nine o'clock in the morning from the Asokore Community Center, through the main street of Effiduase ,through the Regional Hospital to the All Nations University City Campus and ended at the Koforidua taxi station. 
Some placards held by the demonstrators read,'' Oh Maame the old register is fake, so we need new register'', 'Why is NDC afraid of a new voters register?' 'Ghanaians are demanding a new register'', ''Say no to a bloated register'', 'Say no to ECOWAS register'' and among others. 
Mr David Asante, National Coordinator of the pressure group, Let My Vote Count Alliance said the group was genuinely calling for a new voter's register for the country to have a peaceful and credible election in 2016. 
He indicated that all the consultations done by the electoral Commission on the voters register shows that majority of Ghanaians were calling for a new voters register, adding that, there is no choice for the Electoral Commission other than to hear the voice of the people. 
GNA
